article.title: In Photos: IV Around the World
article.description: Gauchos captured their favorite moments from summer travels, near and far, from right here in Isla Vista to exotic cities across continents.
article.content:
Gauchos captured their favorite moments from summer travels, near and far, from right here in Isla Vista to exotic cities across continents.

Third-year Taylor Daoust took a helicopter to the top of Fox Glacier while studying abroad in New Zealand with fellow Gauchos Audrey Berg and Amanda Schweitzer.

Third-year Maya Longtin captured hot steam rising from the Grand Prismatic Spring in Yellowstone National Park.

Fourth-year Rawan Sultan rode a camel and visited the ancient pyramids in Cairo, Egypt.

First-year Christine Choi ventured into Harry Potter World at Universal Studios Hollywood.

Fourth-year Brittany Tholan did marine research with a lab on campus and witnessed a couple of breathtaking, common dolphins right in our own backyard- just offshore of IV Reef.

Daily Nexus Photographer Stephen Manga jumped off a 22-foot cliff in Oahu, Hawaii.

Fourth-year Nate Fritter visited North Lake Tahoe with family.

News Editor Supriya Yelimeli spent a week in India for her cousin’s wedding. Pre-festivity market crawl in Bengaluru, India pictured.

Second-year Josephine Cheng reached the peak of the Sea to Sky Gondola overlooking Squamish River in Vancouver, Canada.

Third-year Kaitlyn Haberlin went hiking around Silver Lake in the Eastern Sierras.

Print

related.title: The Nexus Looks Back: This Year in Photos
related.description: By Jonathon Cuong A diaper-clad reveler chats with law enforcement on Halloween weekend. This year’s Halloween festivities resulted in 196 jail bookings and 249 citations.   By Benjamin Pu ...
related.content:
By Jonathon Cuong

A diaper-clad reveler chats with law enforcement on Halloween weekend. This year’s Halloween festivities resulted in 196 jail bookings and 249 citations.

 

By Benjamin Pu

Incumbent Lois Capps (D.) and former Lieutenant Governor Abel Maldonado (R.) squared off in UCSB’s Pollock Theater in a debate for the 24th District Congressional seat.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

UCSB senior defender Peter McGlynn was arrested after he pushed down a referee at the conclusion of the UCSB men’s soccer game against UC Davis in October.

 


Photo by Magali Gauthier

Thousands of UCSB students aimed for viral fame with the campus’s own version of the Harlem Shake internet meme.

 

Photo by Alex Gonzales

The 2nd annual Gauchella festival brought together a range of campus performing arts groups. .

 

Photo by Audrey Bachelder

“If you’re going to make movies for yourself, you better love your shit. You better get off 24/7 to your own movies … and that’s what I do.”
-Quentin Tarantino, during an appearance at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival in February.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

The 22nd annual Reel Loud Film Festival showcased students’ seven-minute-or-less silent film projects in May. “The Film & Media department’s annual exhibition of student shorts is easily the most anticipated and unique local event for film-lovers.”-Artsweek‘s Corie Anderson.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Best Coast performing in the Hub.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

UCSB Battle of the Bands Winner Alpha Phunk

 

Photo courtesy of Robert Clayton

The balcony of a Del Playa house collapsed during a Deltopia day party with at least four reported as seriously injured. Lawsuits ensued.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

Deltopia 2013 attracted an estimated 15,000-18,000 partygoers–more than any past year.

 

Photo courtesy of Ailea Richter

A backflip off a mail truck during Deltopia 2013.

 
Photo by John Clow

Hundreds of students attended A.S. Senate meetings to voice their opinions on a proposed resolution to divest from companies that “profit from the military occupation of Palestine.”

 

Photo courtesy of Sally Oh

Students gather to protest the A.S. Senate’s decision to strike the revised divestment resolution from the agenda.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

A.S.elections yielded an OPP sweep of all five Executive Board positions and all Senate positions except one.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

The Daily Nexus was reaffirmed.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Headliner Radical Something performing at Chilla Vista 2013.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

Seth Rogen, Craig Robinson and Danny McBride made a brief appearance at UCSB to promote an advanced screening of their movie This Is The End.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Kendrick Lamar at Extravaganza 2013.

 


Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Dada Life gets intimate.

related.title: IN PHOTOS: 3LAU Headlines Welcome Back Concert
related.description: 3LAU (pronounced “Blau”) shook Storke Plaza this weekend with artfully crafted electro-house mashups, while fellow EDM producer Beni Haze blasted Gauchos with dancey beats and heavy bas...
related.content:
3LAU (pronounced “Blau”) shook Storke Plaza this weekend with artfully crafted electro-house mashups, while fellow EDM producer Beni Haze blasted Gauchos with dancey beats and heavy bass. With hordes of new students pouring in to see Las Vegas-based progressive house DJ 3LAU and Virginia-bred producer Beni Haze, this year’s Welcome Back Concert culminated in a flurry of bright lights, bright colors, gyrating bodies and a ton of bass.

Photos by Cameryn Brock

related.title: This Week in Photos: Sept. 28 – Oct. 6
related.description: We look back at the happenings of this past week in photos.
related.content:
We look back at the happenings of this past week in photos.

Credits: Cameryn Brock, Dustin Harris, Kenneth Song, Alex Gonzalez

EDM producer 3LAU headlined the Welcome Back Concert on October 4, 2014. (Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus)

Attendees make noise during the Welcome Back Concert, which featured up-and-coming EDM producer 3LAU. (Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus)

The Meredith Field scoreboard displays the celebration of the UCSB men’s soccer team, as the Gauchos upset No. 3 UC Irvine 1-0 to hand the Anteaters their first loss of the season on Saturday. (Dustin Harris/Daily Nexus)

Flyers, business cards, and candy line the UCSB Recreational Sports table during the on-campus job fair held in the lawn in front of the De La Guerra dining commons during the Week of Welcome. The fair was an opportunity for first-year students to engage with prospective on-campus employers and to explore other organizations. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

Bob Weiss, middle, and Richard Martinez, right, stand somberly as congresswoman Lois Capps speak about the recent passage of AB 1014 and SB 505, laws introduced after a murder spree in Isla Vista last May, where six UCSB students lost their lives. Weiss and Martinez both lost their daughter, Veronika, and son, Chris, respectively during the tragic events. (Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus)

UCSB defender Dylan Murphy (center) and Drake forward Steven Enna (left) battle for the ball in a non-conference match at Harder Stadium, Saturday, September 28. UCSB won the match 4-1 in a rout. (Dustin Harris/Daily Nexus)

A fire performer gives a captivating show in Isla Vista on Saturday night. (Alex Gonzalez/Daily Nexus)

Tortillas always had a special place in UCSB’s heart. Tortilla management has become more efficient in the past several years; now there is a special place always waiting for liberated tortillas. (Dustin Harris/Daily Nexus)
